Posted By: Pigfish99 (7/22/2011 2:10:57 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: These cards aren't that bad. They are cheap, they go towards metalcraft, once you get them out, you don't have to actively do anything with them, and if you get multiple out, you can actually get some decent life gain. [Nourish](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nourish) is 6 life for 2 green. In a proper deck, this can net you way more life for 2 colorless.

posts.post_content: One time, I was about to start a game of EDH when I realized every body had at least some black in their deck, with a few even playing mono. So I threw it in. And, despite being rated a 1.6 star card here, it gained me over 40 life for two mana by the time it was removed. But it is bad in 1v1, so I guess I'll give it a 2/5. And if it was a common, you guys would be ranting about how you pulled five of this junk cycle at the prerelease. It may be uncommon to stop that from happening, like with [Akoum Boulderfoot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Akoum Boulderfoot) and [razor boomerang](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=razor boomerang).

Posted By: psychichobo (10/25/2012 2:08:06 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I personally don't consider this card as bad as the other 2-drop lifegain artifacts. Black is a color that makes use of trading life for advantages like [Bloodgift Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodgift Demon) and [Griselbrand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Griselbrand). Sure, it's still not really worth a slot in someone's library, but still serves a better purpose than Angel's Feather, Kraken's Eye, Wurm's Tooth, and Dragon's Claw.

posts.post_content: One time a player got 4 [Angel's Feather](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angel's Feather)s out, and started gaining 4 life on top of their stupid [Angel of Mercy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angel of Mercy)s and [Venerable Monk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venerable Monk)s. I simply milled the player to death. It happened to be a Duels of the Planeswalkers match, me playing Jace vs Elspeth. In order to win by milling, I had to exile the copy of [Purity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Purity) hiding in the player's deck, so I had to wait until he casted it to [Counterbore](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterbore) it.
posts.html:
